intro: Draba sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-capsula, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its distinctive, spherical or globose seed pods that remain on the plant after flowering. Its flowers are typically small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters. Draba sphaerocarpa thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often growing in well-drained soils at high elevations.
